column1: Älska mig när jag minst av allt förtjänar det, för det är då jag behöver det som mest.
column2: Love me when I least deserve it, because that is when I need it the most.

column3: Any course of action, however immoral or unscrupulous, is justifiable if it achieves a worthy objective.

column1: Äpplet faller inte långt från trädet.
column2: The apple does not fall far from the tree.
column3: Children observe daily and—in their behaviour—often follow the example of their parents.

column1: Är det inte det ena så är det det andra, sa flickan som blödde näsblod.
column2: ‘If it isn’t one thing it’s the other’ said the girl with a nosebleed.
column3: There is always something to be dissatisfied with.

column1: Är huvudet dumt får kroppen lida.
column2: If the head is dumb, the body suffers.
column3: Said when someone hurts him or herself through a foolish act.
Being honest or telling the truth is always the wisest course of action.

column2: Give credit where credit is due.

column1: Äta bör man annars dör man.
column2: One should eat or one dies.

column1: Även dåren tros vis om han tiger.
column2: Even a fool when he holdeth his peace is counted wise.

column1: Även en blind höna kan hitta ett korn.
column2: Even a blind pig may occasionally pick up an acorn.
column3: An incompetent person or an unsystematic approach is bound to succeed every now and then by chance.
Children often understand more than one might think.
